wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Dodds (1819–1891) was a British politician. He was elected as a Liberal Member of Parliament for Stockton-on-Tees in 1868, resigning in 1888 by becoming Steward of the Manor of Northstead.

response: The nomination took place at 11am on 14 January in Durham Town Hall."Re-election of the Judge Advocate-General at Durham" Glasgow Herald, 16 January 1871, Issue 9685 Davison was nominated by George Robson and seconded by HJ Marshall. The mayor asked whether there were any other candidates. After receiving no answer, he asked for a show of hands and declared Davison elected. Davison then thanked the attendees, which included fellow Liberal MPs Hedworth Williamson and Joseph Dodds, who represented the nearby North Durham and Stockton-on-Tees constituencies. He made a short speech in which he claimed that Prime Minister Gladstone still had the confidence of the public. and that the government had kept every promise it had made."Durham City Election" The Standard, 16 January 1871, p3 Following his speech, the town clerk read the formal declaration of election.
